meanings.definition: Accusing someone again of a crime or wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The reaccusing of the suspect led to a heated argument in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The reaccusing of the defendant shocked everyone in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The reaccusing of the cat for knocking over the vase was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her reaccusing of the dog for eating her homework was like a broken record.
meanings.sent5: The reaccusing of the student for cheating was met with disbelief.

meanings.definition: Making a new accusation against someone.
meanings.sent1: She kept reaccusing him of stealing her pen.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to reaccuse the suspect after finding new evidence.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist reaccusing his friend of eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her reaccusing of the neighbor for the noise was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was reaccusing the student of not completing the assignment.

meanings.definition: Charging someone with a crime for a second time.
meanings.sent1: The prosecutor was reaccusing the defendant of the crime.
meanings.sent2: The judge allowed reaccusing the suspect due to new information.
meanings.sent3: The reaccusing of the driver for speeding caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: Reaccusing the employee of theft raised eyebrows in the office.
meanings.sent5: The reaccusing of the politician for corruption made headlines.
